dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 1843 RH: Telehealth Expansion Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mrs. Steel (for herself, Ms. Lee of Nevada, Mr. Smith of Nebraska, and Mr. Schneider) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

Additional sponsors: Mrs. Miller-Meeks, Mr. LaTurner, Mr. Calvert, Mr. Valadao, Mr. Moolenaar, Mr. Bacon, Mr. Newhouse, Mr. Owens, Mr. Mann, Mr. Obernolte, Mr. Davis of North Carolina, Ms. Slotkin, Ms. Van Duyne, Ms. Tenney, Mr. Gooden of Texas, Mr. Tiffany, Ms. Perez, Mr. Kean of New Jersey, Mr. Fitzpatrick, Mrs. Kim of California, Mr. Williams of New York, Mrs. Miller of West Virginia, Mrs. Peltola, Mr. Steube, Mr. Ferguson, Mr. Balderson, Mr. Buchanan, Ms. Malliotakis, and Mrs. Houchin
Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
action.action-instruction: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic
For text of introduced bill, see copy of bill as introduced on March 28, 2023

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to permanently extend the exemption for telehealth services from certain high deductible health plan rules.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Telehealth Expansion Act of 2023.

section.header: Making permanent the safe harbor for absence of deductible for telehealth

subsection.text: Section 223(c)(2)(E) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking In the case of and all that follows through a plan and inserting A plan.
Section 223(c)(1)(B)(ii) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking (in the case of months or plan years to which paragraph (2)(E) applies).
The amendments made by this section shall apply to plan years beginning after December 31, 2024.

endorsement.action-desc: Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
